subject: english
title: 1st Grade English
description: Basic reading, writing, phonics, sight words, simple grammar concepts, and story comprehension

questions.question: What sound does the letter 'B' make?
questions.explanation: The letter B makes the /b/ sound, like in 'ball' or 'book'.

questions.question: Which word rhymes with 'cat'?
questions.explanation: Hat rhymes with cat because they both end with the '-at' sound.

questions.question: What letter does 'Apple' start with?
questions.explanation: Apple starts with the letter A. Say it slowly: A-pple.

questions.question: Complete this sentence: 'I ___ a book.'
questions.explanation: 'I see a book' makes sense. We use 'see' when we look at something.

questions.question: How many letters are in the word 'dog'?
questions.explanation: The word 'dog' has 3 letters: d-o-g.

questions.question: What sound does 'CH' make in 'chair'?
questions.explanation: CH makes the /ch/ sound, like in 'chair', 'cheese', and 'chicken'.

questions.question: Which is the correct way to write this word?
questions.explanation: 'The' is spelled T-H-E. It's a very common sight word!

questions.question: What comes at the end of a sentence?
questions.explanation: A period (.) comes at the end of a sentence to show it's finished.

questions.question: Which word means the opposite of 'big'?
questions.explanation: Small is the opposite of big. Big means large, small means little.

questions.question: What letter makes the /s/ sound in 'sun'?
questions.explanation: The letter S makes the /s/ sound in 'sun'. S is at the beginning.

questions.question: Which word is a noun (names a person, place, or thing)?
questions.explanation: School is a noun because it names a place where you learn.

questions.question: Complete the pattern: cat, bat, hat, ___
questions.explanation: Rat fits the pattern because it rhymes with cat, bat, and hat (all end in -at).

questions.question: What do we call the ABC's?
questions.explanation: The ABC's are called the alphabet. There are 26 letters in the alphabet.

questions.question: Which word has the long 'A' sound?
questions.explanation: Cake has the long A sound (/ay/). The 'e' at the end makes the 'a' say its name.

questions.question: How do we start every sentence?
questions.explanation: Every sentence starts with a capital letter to show it's the beginning.

questions.question: Story: Sam has a red ball. He likes to play with it. What color is Sam's ball?
questions.explanation: The story says 'Sam has a red ball', so his ball is red.

questions.question: Which word has the 'ing' ending?
questions.explanation: Running has the 'ing' ending added to the word 'run'.

questions.question: Story: The cat sits on the mat. The dog runs in the yard. Where does the cat sit?
questions.explanation: The story tells us 'The cat sits on the mat'.

questions.question: What letter comes after 'M' in the alphabet?
questions.explanation: In the alphabet, N comes after M: L, M, N, O, P.

questions.question: Which word is spelled correctly?
questions.explanation: 'Was' is the correct spelling. It's a common sight word!

questions.question: Story: Lily went to the park. She played on the swings. Then she ate lunch. What did Lily do first?
questions.explanation: The story says 'Lily went to the park' first, then she played and ate.

questions.question: What sound does 'SH' make in 'ship'?
questions.explanation: SH makes the /sh/ sound, like in 'ship', 'shoe', and 'fish'.

questions.question: Which word means more than one?
questions.explanation: Cats means more than one cat. We add 's' to make words plural (more than one).

questions.question: Story: Ben loves books. He reads every day. His favorite book is about dinosaurs. What does Ben love?
questions.explanation: The first sentence tells us 'Ben loves books'.

questions.question: Which letters are vowels?
questions.explanation: The vowels are A, E, I, O, U. Sometimes Y can be a vowel too!

questions.question: What is the first word in this sentence: 'The dog barks loudly'?
questions.explanation: 'The' is the first word in the sentence. It starts with a capital letter.

questions.question: Story: Mom baked cookies. They smell so good! The cookies are in the oven. Where are the cookies?
questions.explanation: The story says 'The cookies are in the oven'.

questions.question: Which word has the short 'E' sound?
questions.explanation: Bed has the short E sound (/eh/). The other words have the long E sound.

questions.question: What do we put at the end of a question?
questions.explanation: We put a question mark (?) at the end of questions like 'How are you?'

questions.question: Story: It was raining outside. Emma put on her raincoat and boots. Then she went outside to play. Why did Emma put on her raincoat?
questions.explanation: Emma put on her raincoat because 'it was raining outside'.

questions.question: Which word rhymes with 'book'?
questions.explanation: Look rhymes with book because they both end with the 'ook' sound.

questions.question: Complete this sentence: 'She ___ happy.'
questions.explanation: 'She is happy' is correct. We use 'is' with 'she', 'he', and 'it'.

questions.question: Story: Max has three toys: a car, a ball, and a bear. He plays with the car first. How many toys does Max have?
questions.explanation: The story says 'Max has three toys: a car, a ball, and a bear'.

questions.question: What sound does 'TH' make in 'this'?
questions.explanation: TH makes the /th/ sound in 'this', 'that', and 'they'.

questions.question: Which word is an action word (verb)?
questions.explanation: Jump is an action word (verb) because it shows what someone does.

questions.question: Story: The sun is bright today. Birds are singing in the trees. Flowers are blooming in the garden. What is the weather like?
questions.explanation: The story says 'The sun is bright today', so it's bright and sunny.

questions.question: Which word has two syllables (parts)?
questions.explanation: Rabbit has two syllables: rab-bit. You can clap for each part!

questions.question: What letter does 'zebra' start with?
questions.explanation: Zebra starts with the letter Z. Z makes the /z/ sound.

questions.question: Story: Anna and her dad went fishing. They caught two fish. Then they went home for dinner. Who went fishing with Anna?
questions.explanation: The story says 'Anna and her dad went fishing'.

questions.question: Which word means the opposite of 'hot'?
questions.explanation: Cold is the opposite of hot. Hot means very warm, cold means not warm.

questions.question: Complete this sight word: 'c_me'
questions.explanation: The word is 'come' - c-o-m-e. Come is an important sight word!

questions.question: Story: Tom's birthday party is tomorrow. His friends will come to play games. Mom is making a cake. When is Tom's birthday party?
questions.explanation: The story says 'Tom's birthday party is tomorrow'.

questions.question: What sound does 'QU' make in 'queen'?
questions.explanation: QU makes the /kw/ sound in 'queen', 'quick', and 'quiet'.

questions.question: Which word is a describing word (adjective)?
questions.explanation: Fast is a describing word (adjective) that tells us how something moves.

questions.question: Story: The little mouse was hungry. He found some cheese in the kitchen. The mouse ate all the cheese. Where did the mouse find the cheese?
questions.explanation: The story says the mouse 'found some cheese in the kitchen'.

questions.question: How many sounds do you hear in the word 'cat'?
questions.explanation: The word 'cat' has 3 sounds: /c/ - /a/ - /t/.

questions.question: Which word has the long 'I' sound?
questions.explanation: Kite has the long I sound (/eye/). The 'e' at the end makes the 'i' say its name.

questions.question: Story: Jack planted seeds in his garden. Every day he watered them. Soon, green plants started to grow. What did Jack plant?
questions.explanation: The story says 'Jack planted seeds in his garden'.

questions.question: What comes before 'B' in the alphabet?
questions.explanation: A comes before B in the alphabet: A, B, C, D, E.

questions.question: Story: Sarah loves to read books about animals. Her favorite animal is the elephant. She has three books about elephants. What is Sarah's favorite animal?
questions.explanation: The story says 'Her favorite animal is the elephant'.
